places_with_reviews.name: Shri Kapileshwar Swamy Temple
places_with_reviews.address: VG28+Q99, Kaplieshwar Rd, Shastri Nagar, Shahapur, Belagavi, Karnataka 590001, India

reviews.text:
Kapileshwar Devasthan is a beautiful Shiv mandir located in Belgavi. As we were passing through that area, we went there for quick 5 minutes to seek blessings and ended up being there for over an hour.

The temple premises is extremely clean and well maintained. The Shiva lingam here is self incarnated and temple is believed to be built sometime in 1000 AD. It is also referred to at the inscription in Kamal Basadi located in Belgavi fort. This place is also called as Dakshin Kashi and it is believed that the 12 Jyotirlingam Darshan Yatra is incomplete unless you start it from here.

The temple is adorned with beautiful murals and psintings from puranas. Also there are small temples of other deities as well. A must visit place to seek Bhagwan Shiv's blessing while in Belgavi.

Believed to be one of the oldest and most revered temples of Chennai, Kapaleeswarar Temple is a shrine of Lord Shiva. In the temple, the wife of Lord Shiva, Goddess Parvati is worshipped in the incarnation of Goddess Karpagambal. She is believed to be the 'Goddess of the Wish-Yielding Tree'. Built in the 7th century AD by Pallavas and was destroyed by Portuguese..
One of the oldest Shiva temple in Belgaum. Also Ganpati काळभैरव देवी temples  inthe complex parking available. Shiva thrath kunda along temple complex.

Peace ☮️
Lord shiva temple
And also 3D wall paint work and statue of shiva life …

I'm from north India and I have visited this place countless times. I still remember the first time when I visited this divine temple and the positive energy which I got inside the temple is still with me.

places_with_reviews.name: Kamal Basadi - Belagavi
places_with_reviews.address: VG5C+6H4, Belgaum Fort Area, Belagavi, Karnataka 590001, India

reviews.text:
Kamal Basadi is an ancient Jain temple in Belgavi fort area. It has stone structure in the shape of lotus at the temple ceiling, hence the name.
It's usually open during the day. It very well maintained and one feels calm upon visiting it. We loved our early morning visit.
Note: As this is a religious place, please respect people's sentiments, wear appropriate clothings and maintain decorum of the place.

Beautiful historically loaded place. Well maintained neat & clean premises. Lot of open space & lawn is available outside to relax. Plenty of parking space is available. Situated inside Belagavi fort. Auto available to this place. Appeal to the visitors is that please do not litter inside the premises. You take a walk along the compound wall (time ~1hr). Architecture of the temple is astounding & marvelous.

Beautiful 10th century Jain monument in a serene surrounding. Marvelous granite construction. Makes one wonder how the artisans carved such intricate and smooth pillars without modern technology at that time.

It is a Jain temple carved out of stone. A must see for architecture and history enthusiasts. Ramkrishna Mission Ashram is just besides this place, so you can cover 2 places on a single road.

As for the place, it is surprizingly bleak. It looked like a place where people come to read paper, or watch FB stories loudly. The interior of stone temple so pleasant and cold, but the exterior is mangled by the humans. There is so much intricate stone work, but you need to know your history to admire it. But if a person like me can be amused, then the experts are going to go gaga over this place. But, there is interference there as well. At one place, I saw ghastly blue doors (which are normally seen on toilets) added to temple architecture. It frankly looked hideous. This place made me sad.

If you ask me, you can avoid visiting. If you are a tourist like me, it is fine if you don't go here.

Very peaceful temple complex.. a 20 min stopover is worth here.. lord neminath's statue is calming..
The lotus style temple makes for some peaceful sitting place and a great photo location..
It's a small structure.. the guard was very helpful in telling us about the history etc.

places_with_reviews.name: Military Shri Mahadeva Shiva Temple
places_with_reviews.address: Congress Road (NH- 4A, Hirekodi, Velguem, Camp, Belagavi, Karnataka 590001, India

reviews.text: It was a heartwarming experience visiting this place. To be honest it is one of the best place to spend time with family specially along with the kids. This place is well maintained and clean,sunsets are beautiful here .

This spiritual and devotional place dedicated to Lord Mahadev is managed by the Maratha Life Infantry, showcasing military discipline. Visitors can explore a small zoo featuring deer, emus, rabbits, and other animals, as well as a children's park for kids. Additionally, the site offers views of many forts associated with Shivaji Maharaj.
Best place in Belgaum for sure.. Very calm and nice environment..
Welll maintained shiv temple. Has beautiful garden and playground. Has beautiful Statue of Chhatrapati Shivaji Maharaj. Also there is replica of different forts in Maharashtra.

places_with_reviews.name: ISKCON BELAGAVI
places_with_reviews.address: 211, Srila Prabhupada Marg, Shukrawar Peth Rd, Shivaji Colony, Tilakwadi, Belagavi, Karnataka 590006, India

reviews.text: Iskon temple is the best place for peace and divinity. You will find real happiness in this temple. Must visit place for all age group 5/5

ISKCON Belgav is the oldest and a very beautiful temple I visit it every time whenever I come to belgav, a must visit place for the devotees.
The kirtan ,Bhajan and pravachan timings vary from time to time but basically it is on sunday from 12:30 pm to 2:30 pm followed by mahaprasadum.
🌺हरे कृष्ण🌺

A very beautiful and serene ISKCON temple located in Tilakwadi area of Belgaum.
The temple is big, accommodates 500-800 people at a time, with peaceful ambience, rustic interiors. Many dioramas, paintings depicting Lord Krishnas pastimes are also present inside.

The main deities are Sri Sri Radha Gokulananda, Sri Jagannath Baladev Subhadra and Sri Sri Gaur Nitai. Everyday, many aratis are performed beginning at 4:30 AM in the morning. The best thing about ISKCON temples is how beautifully they decorate the deities with clothes, ornaments and fresh flowers!

Many programs are held in the temple, everyday there are discourses on Scriptures like Srimad Bhagavatam, Bhagavad Gita and so on. festivals like Janmashtami, Ram Navmi etc are celebrated in big scale. On every Sunday there is a special feast for general public and everyone can attend it for free, and they also serve free lunch prasadam after the discourse. They have a special program in the temple on every Ekadashi too.

They also have various other projects like food for life, a Gurukul and Goshala, book distribution marathons and much more. IYF (ISKCON Youth Forum) is quite active too.
The temple also has a dedicated restaurant called 'Govindas', just a little ahead. Also, a gift shop called 'Matchless Gifts' has been started where you can get everything spiritual - from books to murtis, incense, Arati items, eatables, paintings and clothes.

Ample of parking space available too, doubt if there is an wheelchair arrangement but the staff can assist in any such situations too. 0
A must visit temple for some peace of mind and improving spiritual life

The ISKCON temple is a wonderful spiritual haven, offering a serene atmosphere for devotees. The deities exude divine energy, creating a profound experience. The caring and welcoming devotees enhance the sense of community, making the visit truly uplifting. The Govindas at the temple serve delicious prasadam, and the added bonus of free Sunday feast prasadam makes it a delightful place to seek blessings and immerse in spiritual bliss.
Hare Krishna, peace of life and we'll maintain a place. Congested for four wheeler, physically challenged people will get issue to climb the steps, for senior citizens they have chairs to sit

places_with_reviews.name: Shri Paramartha Niketana
places_with_reviews.address: Shriharimandir, 734, Angol Main Rd, Bhagya Nagar, Angol, Belagavi, Karnataka 590006, India

reviews.text:
This Holy Shrine of ParamPujya Shri.Kalavati Aai in Angol, Belgao is where one can easily feel the divine presence. Anyone practicing Meditation can easily understand the value of this place.
There are 3 daily Nitya Upakram of Daily Prayers held at this Shrine that one must attend to understand the Culture better. Dedicated to devotion of God's via Bhajans written by many Hindu Saints and learning from their teachings is one of the temples many principles.
Chanting of the Mantra *Om Namah Shivay* is practiced in the premises beyond which one is barred from talking or making loud noises. The sanctity of this place is Heavenly and thus this must be experienced by all whenever possible.
It's very holy place good for upasana

I am very fortune to have Kalavati Aai as my guru , My 3 days stay over here was best experience in d life. It's a life changing event for me. If you believe in the principals of Aai a must place to visit. A truly divine place.
Peace.. spiritual.. recommended to visit everyone
Salutations to Kalavati Amma, her thoughts are very intriguing and mesmerizing.

places_with_reviews.name: Shri Hindalaga Ganapati Temple
places_with_reviews.address: Hindalaga road ganesh temples banjara colony, 1st Cross, Camp, Belagavi, Karnataka 591108, India

reviews.text: An absolutely divine experience at Hindalga Ganesh Temple! The ambiance is serene and spiritually uplifting, creating a peaceful atmosphere for prayers and reflection. The temple’s mesmerizing idol of Lord Ganesh is truly captivating. Moreover, the temple premises boast a spacious park with playing items for children, making it an ideal destination for families. The presence of this park adds an extra dimension of joy and relaxation to the visit, allowing families to enjoy quality time together in a serene environment. Whether seeking solace, admiring the beauty of the temple, or enjoying family time in the park, Hindalga Ganesh Temple is a must-visit destination in Belgaum. Highly recommended for its spiritual significance, tranquil surroundings, and family-friendly amenities.

places_with_reviews.name: Sharqat Park
places_with_reviews.address: P 112/1, Queens Garden Rd, Laxmi Tek, Camp, Belagavi, Karnataka 590001, India

reviews.text: It's a beautiful park with various swings and other gaming equipment for children to play and walking tracks for adults to stay fit. Beautiful fountains, cascade waterfalls, water streams with wooden bridges are also part of Sharquat Park.Hence, many people can be seen coming during mornings and evenings for walks. There is no entry fee. Park timings are 6am to 9pm . The Park commemorates the heroic act of 114 maharattas, who sacrificed their life to capture the heights of Sharquat which is in Iraq now. One can park their 2 wheeler or 4 wheeler at the road side.

Such a beautiful and small park made in the memory of warriors of Maratha LIRC who fought world war and conquered the heights of sharquat in Iraq. This park is made for commemorating those warriors. Well maintained and the greenery is good for a fresh walk. There is a small kids play area too.
Really Wonderful garden for keep calm and manage stress. Fully green and silent place. Love to go with kids and families.
The place is so clean.The air is so fresh.Kids have many games over there.clean and neat rest rooms.No food facilities available.
Nice garden. It is dedicated in memory of the battle of sharqat. There is one artillary gun on display which was used in battle field by Indian army.

places_with_reviews.name: Ramakrishna Mission Ashrama (Belagavi Kote)
places_with_reviews.address: Fort Rd, Fort Area, Belagavi, Karnataka 590016, India

reviews.text: Divine location. Very peaceful and calm. One can pray here for hours with out getting disturbed. More over, there is a small garden with rose and marigold plants with full of blooms

Quaint and Peaceful place. A space where Swami Vivekananda stayed for a few days.

The large mediation hall. The cosy stay place which is now an exhibition gallery of Swami Vivekananda.. and the campus is beautiful..

If peace of mind is needed through spiritual knowledge visit this place.spiritual Books, programmes and workshops for the youth will provide proper guidance and decision making power

Very artistically designed complex. Calm and quiet and the statue of Swami Vivekanand, the pictures depicting events from his life are impressive.
Very clean restrooms are provided for the visitors.

Calm and peaceful area. Home where Swami Vivekanand stays there for 9 days. There is one mediation centre. Also there is one book shop as well which includes all Hinduism, Mediation and Ramkrishna Mission related books.

This is located within Belgaum fort premises and maintained by the Indian Military. Loved visiting the place. Swami Vivekananda is said to have stayed in one of the houses within Belgaum Fort for some time and land was granted by the Karnataka Government to the Mission for constructing an ashram.  There is a meditation hall where you can meditate, buy books at a book stall or read them there.
